intro: Epilobium asplundii, commonly known as the Sierra buckbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Epilobium asplundii is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, making it a resilient species in arid environments.
